channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: ‘We don't employ your children’: Controversial company memo on sick leave for children sparks outrage
item.description: A company memo stating that employees can no longer take leave to care for sick children has ignited widespread criticism. Shared on Reddit, the memo argues that family responsibilities should not affect work attendance. This stance has been condemned by many as a setback in the struggle for improved work-life balance and employee rights.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: SpaceX launches all-civilian crew for first private spacewalk
item.description: SpaceX's Polaris Dawn mission launched successfully after several weather delays, sending a four-person civilian crew into Earth's Van Allen radiation belts. Led by billionaire Jared Isaacman, this mission includes the first commercial spacewalk and aims to surpass NASA’s Gemini 11 mission’s highest Earth orbit record. The Falcon 9 rocket lifted off from Nasa's Kennedy Space Center.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meghan Markle’s autobiography could be a ‘gold mine,’ says royal expert
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle might capitalize on their strained relationship with the British monarchy through Meghan’s potential autobiography. Royal expert Tom Bower suggests this book could significantly boost their income. The couple is reportedly waiting before openly discussing their royal experiences, aiming to maintain public interest and avoid immediate backlash.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump claims Mark Zuckerberg won't back Kamala Harris; Meta refutes allegations
item.description: Donald Trump alleged that Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg told him he wouldn't vote for a Democrat in the upcoming election, which Meta denies, asserting Zuckerberg's neutrality. This follows Zuckerberg's praise of Trump's response to a shooting incident and his admission of yielding to Biden-Harris administration pressure on Covid-19 content in 2021.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Women are literally not safe anywhere': Serbian rights activist exposes dark side of Telegram groups
item.description: Serbian rights activist Stasa Ivkovic revealed that Telegram groups are sharing illicit sexual content like revenge porn and child pornography. Ivkovic infiltrated these groups, exposing the exchange of intimate photos and personal details. Despite this alarming trend, Serbian authorities have shut down only 13 such groups, leading to calls for stronger legal measures.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Dubai princess launches new perfume, weeks after divorcing her husband. Guess its name
item.description: Princess Shaikha Mahra of Dubai has launched a new perfume line named 'Divorce' following her recent separation from Sheikh Mana Bin Mohammed. She announced the launch on Instagram, revealing a sleek black bottle. Earlier, in July, she announced her public split up on Instagram. The princess is an advocate for women's empowerment and supports local designers in the UAE.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Haitians eating pets row: Who is Allexis Telia Ferrell? Ohio woman behind viral animal cruelty case
item.description: Allexis Telia Ferrell, a 27-year-old from Canton, Ohio, was arrested for allegedly killing and eating a cat. The incident has caused public outrage and fueled an unusual online trend involving Donald Trump memes. Right-wing social media accounts have bizarrely linked the case to unfounded claims about illegal Haitian migrants consuming pets in Springfield, Ohio.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nasa's $5 billion mission to Jupiter's Moon Europa cleared for liftoff — But when will it launch?
item.description: NASA is set to launch the Europa Clipper spacecraft on October 10 to explore Jupiter’s moon, Europa. This $5 billion mission seeks to uncover potential life beneath the icy surface. The spacecraft will endure intense radiation and perform 49 flybys over six years, capturing detailed data using advanced instruments.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris faces criticism over THIS missed opportunity, polling expert Nate Silver says 'it could cost her the election'
item.description: Nate Silver critiques Kamala Harris' decision to select Tim Walz instead of Josh Shapiro as her running mate, potentially jeopardizing key swing states like Pennsylvania. He points out Harris' difficulties with certain voter demographics and stresses the critical role of Pennsylvania's electoral votes in the election outcome.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brazil faces worst drought in 70 years, fuelling wildfires across the country
item.description: Brazil is grappling with its most severe drought in over seven decades, affecting nearly 60% of the nation. This prolonged dryness has led to extreme lows in Amazon basin rivers and numerous manmade wildfires, worsening air quality. The situation remains critical with no significant rain expected until October, making it difficult for firefighters to contain the fires.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barbara Kingsolver to receive 2024 medal for distinguished contribution to American letters
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Eyewitness recounts harrowing I-75 shooting that left five wounded: 'He came running with no shirt’
item.description: A shooting on Interstate 75 near Exit 49 left five people injured and several vehicles hit by gunfire. The suspect, Joseph A. Couch, fled into nearby woods after abandoning his SUV and an AR-15 rifle. Authorities are investigating the motive behind this random act of violence and have offered a reward for information leading to his capture.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Marie Alvarado-Gil? Female senator who allegedly forced male staff to perform sex to keep job
item.description: California State Senator Marie Alvarado-Gil is embroiled in a lawsuit alleging she coerced her former chief of staff, Chad Condit, into performing sexually explicit acts resulting in severe injuries. The complaint outlines a power dynamic and subsequent retaliation against Condit. Her attorney dismisses the allegations as fabricated and financially driven.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Australia sets minimum age for social media. But why?
item.description: Australia is setting a minimum age requirement for social media access to protect its youth online. Supported by a $6.5 million age assurance trial, the new legislation aims to address online harms and enhance parental control. Internet companies must develop a mandatory code to prevent children from accessing inappropriate content.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Are Japanese eels outsmarting predators? Here's what findings revealed
item.description: Scientists in Japan have discovered that Japanese eels can escape from the digestive tract of predatory dark sleeper fish after being swallowed. The eels move backward up the predator's digestive tract and push their tails through the gills to free their heads. This remarkable behavior was observed using X-ray videography, revealing a unique survival mechanism.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kim Jong Un vows to increase North Korea's nukes exponentially
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has committed to significantly enhancing his country's nuclear weapons capabilities and preparing troops for combat. He accused the US and its allies of forming a nuclear-based military bloc in the region. This announcement follows North Korea's recent deployment of new missile launchers and drones as tensions rise with South Korea, the US, and Japan.

item.title: 'Trump grabbed me, ran his hand up my skirt ...': Jessica Leeds recalls 1970s airplane assault, 'Deciding whether to sue'
item.description: Jessica Leeds has renewed her accusation against former President Donald Trump, alleging he sexually assaulted her on a flight in the late 1970s. During a press conference, she described feeling violated and criticized Trump's behavior towards women. Trump denies the allegations, suggesting they are politically motivated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Wildfire in Southern California forces evacuations: Here's what we need to know
item.description: Over 10,000 residents were evacuated as wildfires spread across California, consuming over 20,552 acres. The Line Fire threatens thousands of structures. Fires are also active in Angeles National Forest and Clearlake. Governors declared states of emergency amid excessive heat warnings affecting southern California and neighboring regions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least 40 killed, 60 wounded in Israeli strike on humanitarian zone
item.description: In Khan Yunis, Gaza Strip, an Israeli airstrike on the Al-Mawasi humanitarian zone killed at least 40 people and injured 60 others. The strike hit an area with displaced civilians. Israel claimed it targeted a Hamas command center, but Hamas refuted the presence of its fighters at the site.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man pours boiling coffee on 9-month-old: Australia issues arrest warrant, international manhunt begins
item.description: The search for a man accused of attacking a nine-month-old baby in Queensland has intensified after he fled Australia. Identified on September 1, the suspect left the country on August 31. The infant is recovering from multiple surgeries. Authorities are working internationally to apprehend him and bring him to justice.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
